intro: Bruguiera wightii, commonly known as the mangrove fern, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rhizophoraceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. The plant has specialized root systems that help in stabilizing coastal sediments and filtering out salt. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Bruguiera wightii plays a crucial role in the ecological balance of mangrove ecosystems by providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
